page.title: 15POLICING OF THE MOORLANDS
page.content: ANIMALS-There are several problems for the police with animals on he moors. Firstly there is the problem of sheep worrying. This is particularly dangerous during lambing. The dogs can either be strays or dogs let off the lead by their owners. Landowners are entitled to shoot the dogs and the police have to make sure that they take all necessary precaution. Sheep stealing or rustling is a problem for on the moors the sheep graze over a very wide area particularly in the summer months. There are occasions when there is an outbreak of a very infectious animal disease such as foot and mouth. The Ministry of Agriculture then imposes a restriction of movement of all animals within a certain area. It is up to the police to enforce these regulations.
